Race.SpecificTitle: Member of School Board -- District  6, Zachary Community
Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  3, District  3
PW Plan of Government -- Reorganization of the Dept. of Public Works
Race.FullText: Shall Sections 1.08, 4.03, 5.01, 5.02, 5.03 and 5.04 of the Plan of Government of the City of Baton Rouge and Parish of East Baton Rouge relating to the reorganization of the Department of Public Works be amended, effective on and after January 15, 2015, as more specifically described in the Summary of Proposed Amendments to the Plan of Government Relating to the Reorganization of the Department of Public Works dated September 24, 2014, which Summary of Proposed Amendments to the Plan of Government Relating to the Reorganization of the Department of Public Works may be reviewed on the official website (brgov.com) of the City of Baton Rouge and Parish of East Baton Rouge or may be obtained from the Council Administrator for the City of Baton Rouge and Parish of East Baton Rouge, and which proposed amendments are hereby incorporated by reference and made a part of this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: Goodwood Homesites Crime Prv. & Nbrhd Impr. Dist. -- Parcel Fees - BOC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Goodwood Homesites Crime Prevention and
Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Goodwood Homesites Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District ("District"), be authorized pursuant to La. R.S. 33:9097.20 to impose an annual parcel fee on each improved parcel within the District for five years beginning in 2015 and ending in 2019, in an initial amount not to exceed one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) for residential parcels, four hundred and fifty dollars ($450.00) for commercial parcels and seventy dollars ($70.00) for parcels qualifying for a special assessment level of ad valorem taxes pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Louisiana Constitution and to adjust the fee annually provided said fee does not exceed two hundred dollars ($200.00) for residential parcels, five hundred dollars ($500.00) for commercial parcels and ninety dollars ($90.00) for parcels qualifying for special assessment. Proceeds of the fee (after deducting administrative costs) shall be used to aid in crime prevention, to add to the security of District residents by providing an increase in the presence of law enforcement and to serve the needs of the District residents by funding beautification and improvements for the overall betterment of the District ($56,200 is reasonably estimated to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Tara Crime Prevent. & Improv. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Tara Subdivision Crime Prevention and
Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Tara Subdivision Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a parcel fee on each improved and unimproved parcel within the District for a period of ten years, beginning in 2015 and ending in 2024, in the amount not to exceed One Hundred dollars ($100) per year with the option to increase the fee once during each calendar year not to exceed 10% of the amount of the fee imposed during the previous calendar year and not to exceed Two Hundred dollars ($200) per year, as provided in Act 408 (2014) enacting La. R.S. 33:9097.22, with the proceeds of said parcel fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used to aid in crime prevention, to enhance security within the District, and to provide for the overall betterment of the District (an estimated $56,610 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Central Fire Protection Dist. No. 4 -- 4.25 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Central Fire Protection District No. 4 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Central Fire Protection District No. 4, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana ("the Fire District"), pursuant to Article VI, Section 19 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1501), and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect an ad valorem tax of 4.25 mills (the "Tax") (an estimated $560,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases) in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Fire District for a period of 10 years, commencing in the year 2015 to and including the year 2024, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for salaries, retirement, benefits and related expenses for the Central Fire Protection District No. 4 within Central Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: Villa Del Rey Crime Prevent. & Improv. Dist. -- $150/$75 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Villa del Rey Crime Prevention and
Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Villa del Rey Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District ("District"), be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee in the amount of $150 per parcel for those parcels that do not qualify for the special assessment level provided by Louisiana Constitution Article Vll, Section 18(G)(1) ("Special Assessment") and $75 per parcel for those parcels qualifying for the Special Assessment, subject to an annual increase not to exceed 10% of the fee imposed during the previous year and not to exceed $250 per parcel for parcels not qualifying for the Special Assessment and not to exceed $125 per parcel for parcels qualifying for the Special Assessment within the District for ten years, beginning in 2015 and ending in 2024, as provided in Act 831 (2014) enacting La. R.S. 33:9097.22, with the proceeds of said parcel fee (after deducting administrative costs) to be used to aid in crime prevention, enhance security, provide for an increase in security patrols, beautify and improve the common areas, and provide for the overall betterment of the District ($118,125 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SpecificTitle: University Acres Crime Prev. & Nbrhd Impr. Dist. -- $365 Parcel Fee - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
University Acres Crime Prevention and 
Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the University Acres Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District ("District"), be authorized to levy and collect a parcel fee on each improved parcel not subject to a special assessment level provided by Louisiana Constitution Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) within the District for a period of fifteen years, beginning in 2015 and ending in 2029, in the amount not to exceed Three Hundred Sixty-Five dollars ($365) per year and to increase or decrease the fee annually provided said fee does not exceed Five Hundred dollars ($500) per year, as provided in Act 829 (2014) enacting La. R.S. 33:9097.22. The proceeds of the parcel fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary administrative costs) shall be used to aid in crime prevention by providing security for the District residents, and to serve the needs of the residents of the District by promoting beautification for the overall betterment of the District (an estimated $78,840 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?
